author: Anthony Gaynor
title: Kim Betler Lambert
text:
Kim Betler Lambert
Kim Betler Lambert passed away Monday, June 23, at home in Hickory, North Carolina, with her husband, Greg McGlaughlin, by her side.
Kim was born Jan. 31, 1962, in Marshall County, West Virginia. At an early age, her family moved to Randolph County, where Kim graduated from Tygarts Valley High School. She graduated from Marshall University with masters degrees in the educational field.
Preceding Kim in death were her father, Lawrence, and her mother, Donnie Betler. Also preceding her in death was her first husband, Stan Lambert.
In addition to her husband, Kim is survived by her brother, Stan, and wife, Brenda Betler of Kingwood, West Virginia; and her sister, Sandy and husband, Frank “Preach” Ketterman, of Bowden, West Virginia. Kim also had several nieces and nephews.
Graveside services will be Sept. 27, 2025, at noon at Pickens Cemetery at Pickens, West Virginia.
